LongPipes

Class Backend

  • java.lang.Object
    • LongPipes.Backend

  • public class Backend
extends java.lang.Object
    Backend has methods which do not alter what is seen by the user (i.e. wont alter the label values) and do not apply to pipe objects specifically.
    Since:
    02/12/17

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Backend()
      Backend constructor, creates and instance of a backend so that its methods can be accessed from Frontend

      • totalCostOfOrder

        public java.lang.Double totalCostOfOrder()
        Iterates through the basket to calc the total cost of the order
        Returns:
        totalCost: the sum of all the pipes

      • PipeTypeDetector

        public java.lang.String PipeTypeDetector(int pGrade,
                                         int colourPrint,
                                         int quantOfPipe,
                                         boolean innerInsul,
                                         boolean outerRein,
                                         boolean chemResist,
                                         double Length,
                                         double Diameter)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Based on the attributes of the pipe the method determines if a pipe can be produced by the company, and if so what type (So it can use the correct constructor)
        Parameters:
        pGrade - Plastic grade of potential pipe
        colourPrint - Colour print of potential pipe
        quantOfPipe - Quantity of of potential pipe(s)
        innerInsul - inner insulation of potential pipe
        outerRein - outer reinforcement of potential pipe
        chemResist - chemical resistance of potential pipe
        Length - Length(m) of potential pipe
        Diameter - Diameter (in) of potential pipe
        Returns:
        string pipeCreated - allows the Frontend to display the pipe type made
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if no valid pipe can be made, throw an exception which the Frontend will display

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        writeToFile will output the contents of the order to a .txt file Note: the orderNo which was initialised at the start of this file will reset if the program is closed, thus if orders are created with the same name e.g. newOrder0.txt then the new file will overwrite the old one
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the file encounters an error when being created
